subject: Re: [junit] jar file for com.mock.servlet.*
msgSnippet: easymock by its extension  can mock also classes On Sun, 08 Jul 2007 14:42:01 +0430, Stephen Smith ... -- Using Opera s revolutionary e-mail client:
messageBody:
easymock by its extension can mock also classes

On Sun, 08 Jul 2007 14:42:01 +0430, Stephen Smith
<steve@...> wrote:

> There are a number of different mock frameworks out there, each of which
> has good points and bad points. If you're using
> Spring to develop your web application (good times), it contains its own
> mock classes. If you're not using Spring (bad
> times), I suggest JMock (www.jmock.org).
>
> ---
> Stephen Smith, MEng (Wales).
> http://www.stephen-smith.co.uk/
>
> tksri2000 wrote:
>>
>>
>> Hello,
>> I have been reading about mock objects and I would like to use them to
>> develop junits tests for a servlet that I have recently coded .
>> Where would I find the jar files that would have the mock objects
>> relating to servlets.
>>
>> Thanks..
>> sri
